headline.main: FALSEHOOD' CRY' IN MOVIE HEARING; Willkie Accuses Senator Clark of Distorting His Remark on 'Campaign Oratory'

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 -- The Senate investigation into alleged war propaganda in the movies turned into a rough-and-tumble argument over foreign policy today, culminating in a shouted assertion from Wendell L. Willkie that Chairman Clark of Idaho had broadcast over the country "un qualified falsehoods" regarding his position in this matter.
abstract: H B Warner denies Warner Bros Pictures made propaganda films; reveals Nye's endorsement of film, Confessions of a Nazi Spy, hearing
